item.title: Tara add a quote by Elaine Dundy
item.description: "That's my answer to the question what is your strongest emotion, if you ever want to ask me: Curiosity, old bean. Curiosity every time." -- Elaine Dundy

item.title: Tara add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Tara add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Tara add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Hollywood is a place where they'll pay you a thousand dollars for a kiss and fifty cents for your soul. I know, because I turned down the first offer often enough and held out for the fifty cents." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Tara add a quote by Madonna
item.description: "No matter who you are, no matter what you did, no matter where you've come from, you can always change, become a better version of yourself." -- Madonna

item.title: Tara add a quote by Billie Holiday
item.description: "You can't copy anybody and end with anything. If you copy, it means you're working without any real feeling. No two people on earth are alike, and it's got to be that way in music or it isn't music." -- Billie Holiday

item.title: Tara add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Men reject their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and honor those they have slain." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Tara add a quote by Amy Winehouse
item.description: "What kind of fuckery is this?" -- Amy Winehouse

item.title: Tara add a quote by Marvin Gaye
item.description: "War is not the answer, for only love can conquer hate" -- Marvin Gaye

item.title: Tara add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Tara add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I drank to drown my sorrows, but the damned things learned how to swim." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Tara add a quote by charles bukowski
item.description: "If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose" -- charles bukowski

item.title: Tara add a quote by Donna Tartt
item.description: "Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs." -- Donna Tartt

item.title: Tara add a quote by Hazel Rochman
item.description: "Reading makes immigrants of us all. It takes us away from home, but more important, it finds homes for us everywhere. ." -- Hazel Rochman

item.title: Tara add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms." -- Angela Carter

item.title: Tara add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Tara add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you're going to write, don't pretend to write down. It's going to be the best you can do, and it's the fact that it's the best you can do that kills you." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Tara add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "That would be a good thing for them to cut on my tombstone: Wherever she went, including here, it was against her better judgment." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Tara add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Tara add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Tara add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Tara add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "The story comes around, pushing at our brains, and soon we are trying to ravel back to the beginning, trying to put families into order and make sense of things. But we start with one person, and soon another and another follows, and still another, until we are lost in the connections." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "All of us have failed to match our dream of perfection. I rate us on the basis of our splendid failure to do the impossible. If I could write all my work again, I'm convinced I could do it better. This is the healthiest condition for an artist. That's why he keeps working, trying again: he believes each time that this time he will do it, bring it off. Of course he won't." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "An artist is a creature driven by demons. He doesn't know why they choose him and he's usually too busy to wonder why." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "We have to start teaching ourselves not to be afraid." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "If a story is in you, it has to come out." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "The past is never dead. It's not even past." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "An artist is a creature driven by demons. He doesn’t know why they choose him and he’s usually too busy to wonder why. He is completely amoral in that he will rob, borrow, beg, or steal from anybody and everybody to get the work done." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Tara add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "I don't think anybody can teach anybody anything. I think that you learn it, but the young writer that is as I say demon-driven and wants to learn and has got to write, he don't know why, he will learn from almost any source that he finds. He will learn from older people who are not writers, he will learn from writers, but he learns it -- you can't teach it." -- William Faulkner
